project

Class PokerUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.PokerUtility

  • public class PokerUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Poker Utility that can be used to compare decks to determine which deck wins, as well as compare two decks Can also be used to determine if a deck meets a certain case;
    Since:
    1.0 - 2015-03-31
    Version:
    2.3 - 2015-04-18
    Author:
    Stuart Nolton and Mel Chi

      • compareDecks

        public boolean compareDecks(Deck first,
                            Deck second)
        Compares two decks starting from straightflush, 4 of a kind, fullhouse flush, three of a kind, two pairs, two of a kind, high card
        Parameters:
        first - First deck
        second - Second Deck
        Returns:
        true if first deck wins, true if a tie and the object.tieDeck is true

      • checkStraightFlush

        public boolean checkStraightFlush(Deck theDeck)
        Checks if it is a Straight Flush
        Parameters:
        theDeck - the deck to analyze
        Returns:
        Returns true if is a straight flush, false if it is not.

      • checkNumOfAKind

        public int checkNumOfAKind(Deck theDeck,
                           int num,
                           int ignoreValue)
        Checks if you have the n number of kind.
        Parameters:
        theDeck - Input deck
        num - the number of occurances
        ignoreValue, - input an ignore value, useful when looking for two pair or full house
        Returns:
        return the int of the highest value, returns 0 if there are no n of a kind

      • checkFullHouse

        public int checkFullHouse(Deck deck)
        Check if a deck has a full house
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck you want to check for a full house
        Returns:
        returns the int value of the 3 of a kind, if it returns 0, There is no full house

      • checkFlush

        public java.lang.String checkFlush(Deck theDeck)
        Checks if the deck has a flush
        Parameters:
        theDeck - The deck you want to check for a flush
        Returns:
        Returns the string of the type of flush, returns "N/A" if no flush

      • checkStraight

        public boolean checkStraight(Deck theDeck)
        Checks if the deck has a straight
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • checkTwoPair

        public int checkTwoPair(Deck theDeck)
        Checks if has two pairs
        Parameters:
        theDeck - The deck
        Returns:
        highest pair, highRank2 will hold the 2nd pair value and highRank3 will return the highest kicker

      • getHighCardNoMatter

        public int getHighCardNoMatter(int ignore1,
                               int ignore2,
                               Deck deckGetHighCard)
        Gets the highest card that doesn't matter for n number of cards and 2 pairs
        Parameters:
        ignore1 - the value of the card
        ignore2 - set as 0 or 1 if you do not need it
        deckGetHighCard - The deck you want to find the high card in
        Returns:
        the value in a int of the highest rank of card

      • convertNumRankToRank

        public java.lang.String convertNumRankToRank(int numRank)
        Converts the Rank to a String. i.e. input is 0, and will return "2"; If you have the value of RealNumRank of cards, use the convertRealNumRanktoRank method
        Parameters:
        numRank, - value of cards from 0 to 12
        Returns:
        Rank from "2" to "Ace", if the rank does not exist, it will return "N/A"

      • convertRealNumRankToRank

        public java.lang.String convertRealNumRankToRank(int realNumRank)
        Converts the Rank to a String. i.e. input is 2, and will return "2"; If you have the value of NumRank of cards (i.e input 0 means "2", use the convertNumRanktoRank method
        Parameters:
        realNumRank, - value of cards from 0 to 12
        Returns:
        Rank Returns the rank as a string

      • convertRankToNumRank

        public int convertRankToNumRank(java.lang.String rank)
        Returns num Rank from rank
        Parameters:
        rank - The rank in a string
        Returns:
        Returns the Num Rank from given rank, will return -1 if rank does not exist

      • convertRankToRealNumRank

        public int convertRankToRealNumRank(java.lang.String rank)
        Returns rank to real num rank
        Parameters:
        rank - Rank
        Returns:
        Returns the Real Num Rank from given rank, will return -1 if rank does not exist
